name: Secret of the Magic Crystals
description: In this game you manage a horse-breeding farm set in a fantasy surrounding. The game enables you to breed legendary horses such as Pegasus, Unicorn, Fire-steed, Ice-steed and Demon-steed. You can buy over 700 objects during the game. Make all kinds of horseshoes as well as lots of magical potions for your horses.

i would like to say that i came into this game expecting nothing. but as i continued playing i soon realised that this game is hardcore. it has a whole lot of depth to it. the goal of the game is to make baby horses. you level up your horses' stats (yes, this is an rpg) then get them to breed with a horse of the same level to spawn a horse with an increased level. here is a detailed look at the game.  story - 10/10 grandpa found out that some magic crystals affect horses but nobody believed him. journal guys ridiculed him. so he gave some two kids a crystal each.  graphics - 10/10 even the greatest of gaming machines will struggle to run this beast of a game at the 'Fantastic' graphics setting. however older computers can still run it, as proved by my limited edition windows 97.  gameplay - 10/10 you make your horse run over some sticks and maybe even a log by pressing the arrow keys at specific times to help increase the horses' stats. sometimes your horse can get infected from jumping over too many sticks, so you have to give it a shot to heal it. you can also send your champion horse on quests such as delivering a letter to a guy in some town, or maybe even pull a cart of sticks. as you go on your quest, you can find ingredients to craft things. the game has a very complex drug crafting system. your horse can find herbs and spices as it completes quests, which you can mix together to create drugs. the drugs have no none effects at the moment, but this is an early beta, so it will be implemented soon. there is also a horseshoe crafting system. your horse can find bars of various metals lying on the ground, which he or she will pick up and store for later use. you can craft differing horseshoes from different metals. i currently have a titanium horseshoe on my front left leg, a silver on my front right, and steel horseshoes on my muscular hind legs.  overall - 11/10 this game is beyond perfect, though not for casuls. i highly recommend this game as a gift for kwanza or veterans day or maybe even easter.

Immersing yourself into this immaculate game is like grasping the derivations of the Lorentz transformations. While this game was very difficult and non intuitive, a memorable journey shortly followed that heightened my perspectives forever. This isn't just a game, it's an experience. The only thing that rivals the impeccable gameplay is the fact that there are several inaccuracies that were brought to my attention over the course of the game.  The game revolves around Equus ferus caballus, otherwise known as the domestic horse. Despite the fact that members of this genus have elevated sympathetic nervous system responses, the horses depicted in the game did not fight or flight when I posed an immediate threat to them.   Additionally, the physics engine in this game is terrible and the horses are shown to defy some law that governs physical matter at any given point in time.   Overall, I do not recommend this game unless you are a horse girl or enjoy brushing horses with amorphous objects. I have a fever I'm going to bed.

Being a qualified professional horse trainer is great, but it's not about how much light your horse can shine from its ♥♥♥♥, nor is it about how many races you win, its about how much YOU love your ponies and how much time YOU spend with them.   This game is excellent, but before you buy it, I think you should consider the fact that it requires more of your time than a hardcore MMO addiction. It can take weeks to train just one of your horses to it's maximum level, and we all know that you need a lot more than just one horse to beat this game!  You might be wondering how I am making these claims with only ~2 hours gameplay time. The truth is, I usually play this game while in Afghanistan on deployment, where I don't have an active internet connection and have to use Steam in offline mode. It's a great game to play with all my mates in the military, and it takes our mind off the horrible war that we are fighting.   I highly recommend this to everyone that wants to play the best horse breeding/training sim out there. As I mentioned, it takes up a lot of your time, but in my opinion, it is well worth it!

This game is a life changer. Before Secret of the Magic Crystal I was just your average joe, but now after playing I'm a champion. I'm swooned with the ladies, I always get the headshot, and I have a vast array of horses to ride in to battle. Secret of the Magic Crystals is an epic horse sim RPG that sets you a 5-9 year old child loose on the cruel world of earth that had a metor crash into it to cause horse's dna to change, thus creating a new breed of mystical space horses. Your job as a 5-9 year old is to breed these space horses to make better elite space horses.   You gain money by lending your mystical non-elite or elite space horses to peasents to do their chores. Sometimes you can enter them in the king's arena for glory and money! Now of course to win in the king's arenas you have to train your mystical space horses to be the very best! Now while this task sounds easy, it is not. In order to train your horse you most slowly dance to a beat with your arrow keys. If you train too hard or long, your mystical space horse will get tired and sometimes sick. When your mystical space horses get tired you must let them sleep, but when the mystical space horses get sick you, a 5-9 year old child, must complete alchemy to cure them of their illness.   Alchemy is just 1 of 2 skills in the game you can do. The second skill is smithing. Smithing allows you to craft horseshoes, and saddles for you mystical space horses that give them bonus stats which aid in the king's arena. Alternatively you can also decorate your mystical space horse's stall with items that give them perks in the arena. Secret of the Magic Crystals also has random events, and dynamic weather. Another key feature to the game is upgrading your mystical space horse farm's buildings.   Overall Secret of the Magic Crystals is a deep complex and overall epic mysical horse breeding/training RPG sim that shouldn't be missed! 10/10 would buy and play again.

This game features a deep and interested story that will keep you hooked in for hours. The graphics are outstanding! The horses look like real horses, and you can't even tell the difference between a video of a horse and this game! It is truly oustanding! This game has a ton of quests and the NPC's help the quests come alive. This game is the true definition of a role playing game and should be celebrated for decades after this. I would like to personally thank Bethesda Softworks for helping ID Software port their old Atari Jaguar game to the Macintosh Personal Computer in order for us to be playing this on Steam today.  TL;DR: Amazing Role Playing Game, Must Buy.

When I first played this game, I was unsure of myself, of what I would see within. However, the game begins with a gripping story. The game tells of a renowned Harvard zooligist, presenting his findings to his superiors. He spoke of mystical stones which would grant horses special abilities. Not believing him, he was laughed out of his position. He then gives his findings to his son/daughter and gives them the tools necessary to become the very best trainer in all of Horseland.  The gameplay is particularly gripping, and brings you all of the things you loved from Dance Dance Revolution. Once your Horse-which you may have summoned from the ice planet of Hoth, the surface of the Sun, or the depths of hell itself- masters the fine art of dancing, he can compete in competitions with other, more boring horses. This part is the most gripping, and is particularly revolutionary for an indie game. The competitions involve watching a slider move across the screen very slowly, and require no input from the player. This moves beyond anything a video game has ever done, and transcends graphics. Instead of showing the player what happened, the player is allowed to explore the depths of his imagination. As the horses gallop across the finish line, the player knows he's made an amazing purchase.  This is a game that will live on for the rest of time; the creation of this game will be the one crowning achievement in all of humanity's history. Long after the human race is extinct, this game will drift through the cosmos, telling the story of the human condition.  In conclusion: 10/10. Would play again.

At first, I decided to play this game as a joke, while waiting for better games to download. However, after 2 hours of playing I found myself oddly invested in the breeding game, enjoying myself as I made my ponies do rounds in the coral, getting the best stats etc.  Pros: - A good range of horses - A nice selection of items for your horses to try - A decent breeding system - Alchemy. That's right this has alchemy. Well... Potion making.  - Easy mini games  Cons: - Anyone over the age of 12 is not the intended audience (this should be obvious) - Background music can get repetitive - Your horses will get sick a lot, and the medicine is expensive - Very little reward for activities you do  All in all I would - despite the cons, recommend this game if you wanted something to entertain yourself with while bored, or have children coming over who love horses.
